WorkItem.Description:
A second _m_ (lowercase _m_) command is not executed correctly when the last path element is closed with a z command. The z command has no valid start and end point, thea are always zero.

Solution:
Modify construktor of __SvgClosePathSegment__ (Visual Basic Code):
```
   Public Sub New(ByVal Start As PointF, ByVal [End] As PointF)
      MyBase.New(Start, [End])
   End Sub
```

In method __Parse__ of __SvgPathBuilder__:
1) Add a local variable
```
    Dim mStartOfActElement As PointF
```
2) Fill this variable when executing an _M_ or _m_ command
              Case "M"c, "m"c
                  mSegments.Add(New SvgMoveToSegment(ToAbsolute(mCoords.Item(0), mCoords.Item(1), mSegments, mIsRelative)))
                  mStartOfActElement = mSegments.Last.End
                  ...
3) Use it when executing the _z_ command
               Case "Z"c, "z"c 
                  mSegments.Add(New SvgClosePathSegment(mSegments.Last.End, mStartOfActElement))
                  ...
